title: Honoring Essie Duggan upon the occasion of her designation for special recognition after a lifetime of many achievements
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  Essie Duggan upon the occasion of her
designation for special recognition after a lifetime  of  many  achieve-
ments

WHEREAS,  Individuals  who give of their time and energies and serve the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; and
  WHEREAS, Essie Duggan has given not only of her time and energies  but
also of her competence, intelligence and leadership and consequently has
been designated for special honor; and
  WHEREAS,  This  Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Essie Duggan
upon the occasion of her designation for  special  recognition  after  a
lifetime of many achievements; and
  WHEREAS,  A native of Tannille, Georgia, Essie Duggan is a graduate of
Delaware State University and  holds  a  Master's  degree  in  Religious
Education  from  New  York University; she has received additional reli-
gious training from New York School of the Bible; and
  WHEREAS, Essie Duggan's desire to become a "Servant" to  the  Brooklyn
Community began shortly after her arrival here in 1971; her mission over
these  years  has  been  to  "Serve God's People, enabling them to be in
control of their destiny"; and
  WHEREAS, Essie Duggan joined Wayside Baptist Church in  the  mid-1970s
and  has served faithfully under the leadership of Pastor Emeritus Theo-
dus Hutchinson and for 22 years under the current leadership  of  Pastor
Joe L. Parker; and
  WHEREAS, As a dedicated Sunday School teacher, Essie Duggan has taught
all  age  groups  as  well  as  challenged students and is currently the
Christian Education Director, a position she has held for 24 years; and
  WHEREAS, She has served as Youth Director for the New York  Missionary
Baptist  Association;  Supervisor  of  the  Junior  High School Teachers
Department for the New York  State  Progressive  Congress  of  Christian
Education;  and  assisted in developing curriculum for training youth as
peer leaders for American Baptist Churches Metro; and
  WHEREAS, Essie Duggan has been called upon to contribute her time  and
talents to countless civic and charitable endeavors and has always given
of herself unstintingly; and
  WHEREAS,  In  her community outreach for Wayside Baptist Church, Essie
Duggan is a founding member of Care Beyond Neighborhood, Inc., an after-
school and summer youth tutorial program,  and  Wayside  Baptist  Church
Senior  Programs,  which  include  home care, meals on wheels and family
shelters; and
  WHEREAS, Essie Duggan's community service  includes  serving  as  past
president  of  the  600  Bainbridge Street Block Association, 1978-1990;
past School Board Member, District 23; Community Board Member,  District
16;  Female District Leader, 55th A.D., 1994-present; founding member of
the O.B.U.S.T.Y.;  founding  member  of  Northeast  Housing  Development
Corp.;  founding  member  of  Oceanhill Fayeene Construction Company and
founding member and former Executive Director of Central Brooklyn Devel-
opment Corp.; and
  WHEREAS, Professional memberships include 100  Women  for  Congressman
Major  Owens  and  African American Clergy and Elected Officials; she is
also a member of the N.A.A.C.P., Church Women United and a  life  member
of National Council of Negro Women; and
  WHEREAS, Essie Duggan is the recipient of the Spiritual Leaders Award;
Service  and  Dedication  Award to Children from School District 23; the
Teacher of the Year Award, from The New York State Progressive  Congress

of  Christian Education and The Achievement in Religious Education Award
from Wayside Education Support Program (WESP); and
  WHEREAS,  Throughout  the  entire  period  of her community service, a
period of constructive involvement, Essie Duggan has stood  constant  in
dignity, good grace and humor; and
  WHEREAS, Rare indeed is the impressive dedication shown by an individ-
ual  for the benefit of others which Essie Duggan has displayed through-
out her life; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  that  those  who
enhance  the well-being and vitality of their community and have shown a
long and sustained commitment to excellence certainly  have  earned  the
recognition and applause of all the citizens of this great Empire State;
now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Essie Duggan upon the occasion  of  her  designation  for  special
recognition after a lifetime of many achievements; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Essie Duggan.
